A police corporal and a soldier are currently receiving treatment at the University of Maiduguri Teaching Hospital for injuries they sustained in a scuffle over the payment of census enumerators. The incident happened at Jere local government area of Borno State last Sunday during the payment of allowances to adhoc staff engaged by the National Population Commission (NPC). Sources told Daily Trust that the clash occured when security men tried to resolve a disagreement between NPC officials and the adhoc staff over the payment of allowances.

At least 22 people were killed yesterday in Onitsha, Anambra State in what was described as a reprisal attack over the religious violence that erupted in Maiduguri, Borno.
Christians riot in response to Muslim riots in North
Angry traders chanting protest songs demonstrated in the city over state security services perceived failure to stem religious rioting over the weekend that led to over two dozen deaths.
In Bauchi, where 10 people were killed on Monday after the supposed "desecration" of the Koran by a school teacher, a dawn-to-dusk curfew had been imposed to pre-empt further clashes.
Muslims clash with police during riots in Bauchi.

Troops enforced a curfew in parts of northern Nigeria on Sunday after protests over cartoons of the Prophet Mohammed triggered riots in two cities that left 26 people dead and 11 churches burned. In Katsina, police opened fire into a crowd of stone-throwers, killing one and injuring others. Churches were also burned in Katsina, he added, but it was not known how many. An earlier toll had put the number of dead in Saturdays violence in the two northern cities of Maiduguri and Katsina at 16.

Nigerian rioters killed an estimated 23 people Saturday after a Muslim protest against the publication of cartoons of the Prophet Mohammed descended into violence. Witnesses told AFP that protesters turned on the Christian minority in the northern city of Maiduguri, burning shops and churches, after police dispersed a rally called to condemn European newspapers that printed the caricatures. An earlier toll had put the number of dead in Saturdays violence in the two northern cities of Maiduguri and Katsina at 16.
Nigerian Muslim rioters looted and burned Christian churches and businesses Saturday after police halted a protest against the publication of cartoons of the Prophet Mohammed.
